name_full: 胡安·巴勃罗·萨拉梅利亚 Juan Pablo Zaramella
birth_place: 阿根廷,布宜诺斯艾利斯
introduction: Juan Pablo Zaramella was born in Buenos Aires, Argentina in 1972.Graduated at the Instituto de Arte Cinematografico de Avellaneda as Animation Director, he began his career making animations for advertisement.In 1998 he started to work as an illustrator and graphist for Clarín newspaper. Some of his works there have won several international awards from SND (Society of News Design) and Malofiej (Spain).Since 2000, Juan Pablo has been making independent animated shorts with the producer Silvina Cornillón. These films have been awarded prizes all around the world.His short film Journey to Mars, made in collaboration with the scriptwriter Mario Rulloni, has already won more than 50 prizes around the world.His last independent film is Lapsus.Shorts:The Glove     2001 / 10 min / Special Prize-Hiroshima Animation Festival 2002, Best Short 2003-INCAA, Best Short Svenos Cortos 2002The Challenge To Death    2001 / 3'16" / Anima Mundi 2002 Rio de Janeiro - Best Short, Svenos Cortos 2002 - Best Animated ShortJourney to Mars    2004 / 16 min / 50 International AwardsSexteens     2006 / 5 min / Pix Jeunesse International 2008 - First Prize, Anima Mundi 2006, Rio de Janeiro & Sao Paulo - Best PortfolioLapsus     2007 / 3'30" / Hiroshima 2008 - Special Jury Prize, Anima Mundi Sao Paulo - Best Short '07, Annecy 2007 Official Competition, Sundance 2008 - Animation SpotlightLuminaris     New short, coming soon
